critique: This document is an executive order that amends a previous executive order from 1873. It pertains to officers and employees of the Police or Prison Departments of the territorial and municipal governments of the Virgin Islands being appointed to positions in the office of the United States Marshal for the Virgin Islands. It seems to be addressing a specific situation in the Virgin Islands and doesn't have broad implications for the entire country. It is difficult to assess a strong ideological tilt. It does not seem to have implications for immigration. It is difficult to assess whether this expands executive power. It is difficult to assess whether this favors state or federal primacy. It is difficult to assess whether this impacts national security or civil liberties. It is difficult to assess whether this impacts economic regulation. It seems to allow Virgin Islands officers and employees to hold positions as deputy or other employee in the office of the United States Marshal for the Virgin Islands, which could be seen as promoting inclusivity.
